About us
 	In one small town lived four developers: HEROIN, ALEX2014, briabeego and LEF0RT0V0. They were great friends and loved to work together on new projects. One day they decided to develop an Android app called "NashBonus". The app was supposed to help users find discounts and promotions at local stores.
 	The developers started working with great enthusiasm. They chose the Kotlin language and the Android Studio IDE. HEROIN did the design, ALEX2014 did the backend, briabeego did the frontend, and LEF0RT0V0 did the testing.
 	Working on the application was a lot of fun. The developers were constantly joking and laughing. They even invented nicknames for themselves: HEROIN became the "Chief Designer", ALEX2014 became the "Backend Guru", briabeego became the "Frontend Master", and LEF0RT0V0 became the "Tester Father".
 	After a few months, the app was ready. The developers were very happy with the result. They published the app on Google Play and waited for feedback from users.
 	The feedback was very good. Users praised the app for its user-friendly interface, wide selection of stores, and up-to-date discounts. The app quickly became popular and took the leading position in the "Discounts and Promotions" category.
 	The developers were very happy. They had achieved success by working together. They decided to continue their cooperation and develop several more applications.
 	But one day, a misfortune happened. HEROIN got sick and died. His friends were devastated. They couldn't believe that HEROIN was gone. The developers decided to continue working on the NashBonus app. They dedicated it to the memory of HEROIN. The app became even more successful than before. It helped people save money and also helped them remember HEROIN.
